column4: just installed ubuntu for the first time.  Love the install, but....vid drivers weren't there
anyone know how to get some for a Dimension 3000's onboard Intel chipset?
Intel 82865G
we got the same thing
now where do I find the driver?
Intel 82865G Integrated Graphics Device, to be exact
ok, wait...
it's in there already
and yet it doesn't let me choose anything other than 640x480
in the screen resolution tool jobby
known bug
so i'm stuck then?
no, you just need to edit the config manually
in my Monitor section in xorg.conf, I have this:
yo ucan find the values for those from the "monitorrange" line in the output of "sudo ddcprobe"
yes, add only the lines I mentioned (with the right values) to the Monitor section
just the refresh rates?
indeed
you may need to add resolutions at the bottom later, if they aren't there already
the very bottom, or in "Screen"?
thanks
VertRefresh     48-160
